fact_list.fact_text: Pedal cyclists should obey marked signs.
No parking of bicycles sign prohibits riding of pedal cycles beyond the point marked by the sign.
Cyclists should install a front light and rear light or reflector for cycling during hours of darkness.
A properly secured seat is required for pillion riders below 12 years old.
Cyclists should always obey traffic light signals.
Cyclists should cycle with the flow of traffic when on the roads.
Cyclists should always dismount at pedestrian crossings and push their bicycles across.
Cyclists should not cycle along footways, expressways, or overhead bridges.
Minimum age for power-assisted bicyclists and pillion passengers is 16 years old.
Cyclists must wear protective helmets when riding power-assisted bicycles.
Power-assisted bicycles must be registered and affixed with a rear number plate.
Bicycles should be secured with a strong lock when left unattended.
Cyclists can affix a Bicycle Security Label available from any Neighbourhood Police Centre to identify their bicycles with a unique serial number.
